name: Tawaf
description: Circumambulation of the Kaaba seven times counterclockwise

steps.title: Make Intention (Niyyah)
steps.description: Stand at the Black Stone corner (Hajar al-Aswad) and make your intention for Tawaf. Face the Kaaba and say: 'Bismillah, Allahu Akbar'
steps.duaTranslation: In the name of Allah, Allah is the Greatest
steps.tip: Ensure you are in a state of ritual purity (Wudu) before beginning Tawaf.

steps.title: Start at Hajar al-Aswad
steps.description: If possible, kiss or touch the Black Stone. If not able, face it and point towards it with your right hand while saying 'Allahu Akbar'.
steps.tip: Do not push or harm others to reach the stone. Pointing from a distance is perfectly valid.

steps.title: Walk Counterclockwise
steps.description: Keep the Kaaba on your left side and walk counterclockwise. This is one circuit (shawt). You need to complete seven circuits.
steps.tip: Men should expose their right shoulder (Idtiba) during Tawaf. Keep your right shoulder bare.

steps.title: Pass Al-Hijr (Hateem)
steps.description: When passing the semicircular wall (Al-Hijr or Hateem), walk outside it. This semicircular area is considered part of the Kaaba.
steps.tip: It is Sunnah to make special dua while at the Multazam (the wall between the Black Stone and the door of the Kaaba).

steps.title: Complete Seven Circuits
steps.description: Continue walking until you complete seven full circuits. Each circuit ends when you return to the Black Stone corner.
steps.tip: Recite duas freely during Tawaf. There are no specific duas required, though many traditional duas are recommended.

steps.title: Pray Behind Maqam Ibrahim
steps.description: After completing seven circuits, pray two rak'ahs (units of prayer) behind Maqam Ibrahim if possible. Recite Surah Al-Kafirun and Surah Al-Ikhlas.
steps.dua: رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّا إِنَّكَ أَنتَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
steps.duaTranslation: Our Lord, accept this from us. Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing.
steps.tip: If you cannot pray behind Maqam Ibrahim due to crowds, you may pray anywhere in the mosque.

steps.title: Drink Zamzam Water
steps.description: After your prayers, go to the Zamzam water station and drink, making dua while drinking and facing the Kaaba.
steps.dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْماً نَافِعاً وَرِزْقاً وَاسِعاً وَشِفَاءً مِنْ كُلِّ دَاءٍ
steps.duaTranslation: O Allah, I ask You for beneficial knowledge, abundant provision, and cure from all diseases.
steps.tip: Drink while standing, facing the Qibla, and in three gulps. Zamzam is pure and blessed.

name: Sa'i
description: Walking seven times between the hills of Safa and Marwa

steps.title: Proceed to Mount Safa
steps.description: After Tawaf and Zamzam water, proceed to the hill of Safa. Climb it until you can see the Kaaba, then face the Kaaba.
steps.tip: Sa'i is performed in a state of ritual purity, but Wudu is not strictly required.

steps.title: Make Dua at Safa
steps.description: At Safa, face the Kaaba, raise your hands, and recite the opening dua three times.
steps.dua: إِنَّ الصَّفَا وَالْمَرْوَةَ مِنْ شَعَائِرِ اللَّهِ
steps.duaTranslation: Indeed, Safa and Marwa are among the symbols of Allah
steps.tip: Make heartfelt personal dua in your own language here. This is a powerful moment.

steps.title: Walk to Marwa (First Lap)
steps.description: Walk from Safa towards Marwa. In the area marked by green lights, men should walk briskly (or jog slightly). Women walk at normal pace throughout.
steps.tip: The green light area represents the valley where Hajar searched desperately for water.

steps.title: Make Dua at Marwa
steps.description: Climb Marwa, face the Kaaba, and make dua. This completes the first lap. You now need 6 more laps.
steps.tip: One lap is from Safa to Marwa. The return trip (Marwa to Safa) counts as the second lap.

steps.title: Complete Seven Laps
steps.description: Continue walking back and forth. Start at Safa (lap 1), end at Marwa (lap 7). Always make dua at each hill.
steps.tip: Keep track of your laps. The Sa'i ends at Marwa (odd-numbered laps end at Marwa, even at Safa).

steps.title: Hair Cutting (Halq or Taqsir)
steps.description: After completing Sa'i, men should cut or shave their hair. Women cut a small piece (fingertip length) of their hair. This officially ends Umrah.
steps.tip: Hair cutting releases you from Ihram restrictions for Umrah.

name: Ihram
description: The sacred state and garments of pilgrimage

steps.title: Purification (Ghusl)
steps.description: Perform a full ritual bath (Ghusl). This is Sunnah before entering Ihram. It applies to both men and women.
steps.tip: If Ghusl is not possible, perform Wudu (ablution).

steps.title: Men's Ihram Garments
steps.description: Men wear two unstitched white cloths: one wrapped around the waist (Izar) and one draped over the upper body (Rida). No underwear or sewn garments.
steps.tip: Choose lightweight, breathable fabric suitable for Mecca's heat.

steps.title: Women's Ihram
steps.description: Women wear their regular modest clothing that covers the body (except face and hands). Women do not have a specific 'uniform' for Ihram.
steps.tip: Women should not wear niqab (face veil) or gloves while in Ihram.

steps.title: Make Intention (Niyyah)
steps.description: At the Miqat (boundary station), make your intention for Umrah or Hajj. Say: 'Labbayk Allahumma Umrah' for Umrah or 'Labbayk Allahumma Hajj' for Hajj.
steps.duaTranslation: Here I am, O Allah, for Umrah
steps.tip: The Miqat for those coming from most directions is at Dhul Hulaifa (Abyar Ali), Juhfa, Qarn al-Manazil, Yalamlam, or Dhat Irq.

steps.title: Recite Talbiyah
steps.description: After making intention, begin reciting the Talbiyah continuously until arrival in Mecca.
steps.dua: لَبَّيْكَ اللَّهُمَّ لَبَّيْكَ، لَبَّيْكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ لَبَّيْكَ، إِنَّ الْحَمْدَ وَالنِّعْمَةَ لَكَ وَالْمُلْكَ، لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ
steps.duaTranslation: Here I am, O Allah, here I am. Here I am, You have no partner, here I am. Verily all praise and blessings are Yours, and all sovereignty. You have no partner.
steps.tip: Men recite Talbiyah aloud; women recite quietly.
